intro: Varronia grisebachii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a distinctive bell shape. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Varronia grisebachii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or limestone soils.
